title.narrative: POWERR: Promotion of Women’s Equality, Rights and Responsibilities

description.narrative: International Medical Corps UK (IMC UK) remains a key partner and one of the few organizations recognized by the GBV sub-sector for providing comprehensive GBV response services in Borno. IMC UK’s GBV program interventions primarily focus on strengthening community protection and resilience systems and structures. Through funding from the Government of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in 2018, IMC UK’s capacity to build and expand its services for IDPs, especially women and adolescent girls, created a community-based network of operations in nine communities with the establishment of Women and Girls Safe Space (WGSS) and prevention and awareness-remaining activities. To prevent duplication of interventions, the GBV sub-sector and partners providing GBV services in five of the nine affected communities, have selected IMC UK as the lead INGO providing comprehensive GBV services in the targeted communities. The initial funding from the Kingdom of the Netherlands concluded in July 2020, reducing IMC UK’s ability to provide services to roughly half of the previously targeted beneficiaries (160,000 out of approximately 290,000). The funding requested under this grant will enable IMC UK to reach an additional 130,000 beneficiaries in 5 IDP camps and host communities that faced gaps in key GBV prevention and response services with the conclusion of our previous grant. In additional to comprehensive GBV services, with an increased focus on Human Rights, IMC UK proposes to increase sustainability and the capacity of a national community-based organization (CBO) through the identification of a local partner to promote ownership and the increased potential of expanding key interventions including Women and Girls Safe Space (WGSS) activities, the Engaging Men through Accountable Practices (EMAP) approach and the Economic and Social Empowerment (EA$E) of women and adolescent girls, interventions.

Provide focused response services for survivors of GBV; Strengthen psychosocial support and empowerment opportunities for women and adolescent girls; Mobilize communities and key partners to prevent GBV

title.narrative: 1. Provide focused response services for survivors of GBV
Proportion of survivors who report satisfaction with the Case Management services

comment.narrative: All 27 survivors surveyed express satisfaction with the case management services received including refferals made to other service provider.
All 27 survivors surveyed express satisfaction with the case management services received including refferals made to other service provider.
100% of the 20 survivors surveyed reported satisfaction with the case management services they were provided with

title.narrative: Percentage of reporting GBV survivors provided with focused case management services disaggregated by sex and age

comment.narrative: Incidents reported included: rape-2, physical assault-30, psychological & emotional abuse-15, and denial of resources, opportunities and services-41, forced marriage-2, sexual assault-1. All survivors received case management services from IMC's WGSS. 100% of the survivors are females

title.narrative: Number of collective case review meetings conducted with case workers to ensure quality of case management and counselling

comment.narrative: 2 case review meetings were conducted Monthly during this quarter which gives us the total of 6. An additional 45 individual supervison sessions were done to support GBV caseworkers with specific challenges in their management of GBV cases.

title.narrative: Percentage of trained service providers who show an increase knowledge of at least 30% in key GBV topics during training.

comment.narrative: 64% of 20 service providers trained on GBV core Concept and refferals pathway showed improved knowledge based on pre- and post-test result.

title.narrative: Percentage of rape survivors who report within 72 hours referred for appropriate medical care, including PEP to prevent HIV.

comment.narrative: The 2 rape survivors who reported within 72 hours were referred for appropriate medical services.

title.narrative: 3. Mobilize communities and key partners to prevent GBV
Number of women and adolescent girls who received material support based on vulnerability criteria

comment.narrative: Many of these targets are lower than the baseline due to the baseline data including the outcomes of the previous project.
Women : 343 Girls : 118

title.narrative: Percentage of women reporting spouses/partners assisting with household chores

comment.narrative: This indicator will be evaluated during the Q4 reporting period
This was reported in Y1Q4 however another survey is scheduled for Y2Q3

title.narrative: Number of women, men, adolescent boys and adolescent girls reached with information on GBV prevention, human rights, and available services.

comment.narrative: topics covered include: GBV concepts, COVID-19 risk mitigation, human rights and GBV. The breakdonw of participants: Girls = 7723 Women=10932 Boys=7343 Men=10278 Women=9215 Boys=5954 Men=8428

title.narrative: A local partner is identified, trained and able to implement key activities (WGSS, EMAP and EA$E models)

comment.narrative: A local partner was identified in Q2 of year 1 of the project

title.narrative: Number of people trained (non-GBV service providers) in basic concepts, referral pathway, PSEA (disaggregated by target group, sex, training topics)

comment.narrative: Male: 23 Female: 7

title.narrative: Number people participating in structured EMAP discussion groups.

comment.narrative: 180 (females-90, Males 90) from direct IMC implementation

title.narrative: Number of capacity building assessment conducted and action plan developed with partner on continuation of intervention after project phase out

comment.narrative: This has already been achieved in the overall project and no longer planned for this year

title.narrative: 2. Strengthen psychosocial support and empowerment opportunities for women and adolescent girls
Number of adolescent girls completing a 12-week life skills course.

comment.narrative: 25 adolescent girls across 5 locations

title.narrative: Percentage of husbands/partners of women enrolled in EA$E program who attend at least 5 of 8 discussion group sessions (DGS)

comment.narrative: 66(88%) of the 175 spoues/partners completed 5 out of the 8 EASE/DGS sessions

title.narrative: Number of new women benefiting from EA$E program

comment.narrative: Additional 3 group was created (75 Women) plus 175 women from the previous 5 group

title.narrative: Percentage of adolescent girls who participate in life skills course who proceed to the next grade level in school.

comment.narrative: this indicator is not applicable

title.narrative: Number of new women and adolescent girls who participate in safe space group psychosocial activities monthly

comment.narrative: All 124 females (Women=87, Girls=37) accessed IMC WGSS for the first time in January, February and March 2022)

title.narrative: Proportion of women and girls who accessed IMC psychosocial/group support services report satisfaction with quality of services provided
Proportion of adolescents who report increased confidence of 40% in decision-making and communication skills at the end of the life skill course
